abstract: Jim O’Neil, who as chief of United Kingdom Financial Investments has been in charge of the British government’s stakes in two bailed-out banks, will rejoin Bank of America Merrill Lynch.
snippet: Jim O’Neil, who as chief of United Kingdom Financial Investments has been in charge of the British government’s stakes in two bailed-out banks, will rejoin Bank of America Merrill Lynch.
lead_paragraph: LONDON – Jim O’Neil, who has been in charge of the British government’s stakes in Royal Bank of Scotland and the Lloyds Banking Group, resigned on Thursday to return to Bank of America Merrill Lynch.

headline.main: Chief of Unit Overseeing Britain’s Bailout Investments Resigns
